div1.p: The Mercantile Bank of the Americas has questions regarding Carter's deposit.

div1.head: Letter from The Mercantile Bank to Henry Rose Carter, May 18, 1922
div1.opener:
CABLE ADDRESS
BAMERICAS, NEW YORK
UNDER SUPERVISION OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE BOARD
MERCANTILE BANK OF THE AMERICAS
INCORPORATED
AN AMERICAN BANK FOR FOREIGN TRADE
44 PINE STREET NEW YORK May 18, 1922.
IN REPLYING PLEASE MENTION
FAH: SJ
Mr. H.R. Carter,
2121 California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
We acknowledge receipt of your letter of
May 17th handing us certificate of deposit #1240
dated March 8, 1921, issued by the Banco Mercantil
Americano del Peru, Lima, in your favor for £p.1,000.

The cablegram from Dr. Henry Hanson which
you state you were enclosing in your letter, has not
come to hand. We are in doubt whether you merely
desire us to instruct the Banco Mercantil Americano
del Peru, Lima, to attend to Dr. Hanson's instructions
for the conversion of the Peruvian Pounds into U.S.
Dollars or whether you desire the Dollar equivalent
to be paid to Dr. Hanson, or again, whether you desire
the resulting Dollars to be transferred to you.

Please let us hear from you in this regard
when we shall be pleased to transmit your instructions
to the Banco Mercantil Americano del Peru, Lima.

We are retaining the certificate of deposit
awaiting your reply before taking any action.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, MERCANTILE BANK OF THE AMERICAS, INC.
[unclear]
Assistant Secretary.
